node.title: Why Australia's T20 World Cup victors were wearing ski goggles during their celebrations
node.alt: Marcus Stoinis takes a selfie wearing goggles with the Australian team in the background
node.description: Australia's victorious T20 World Cup team partiesÂ in Dubai wearing ski goggles as the cricket world reacts to the historic win.
node.content:
["Ski goggles are not normally essential luggage when heading to the Middle East, but it seems Australia's victorious T20 World Cup team didn't get that memo.", "Partying together after their historic victory over New Zealand in Dubai, Aussie cricketers Glenn Maxwell, Matthew Wade and Marcus Stoinis joined a growing trend of sports stars celebrating their success decked out in the oversized eyewear.", "It's a trend that is believed to have been started in 2013\u00a0when the Miami Heat's Ray Allen brought a pair of goggles into the change rooms to celebrate the team's NBA Championship victory over the Spurs.", "Since then, everyone from Giannis Antetokounmpo at the Milwaukee Bucks to Brandon Smith at the Melbourne Storm have followed suit.", "", "
Glenn Maxwell celebrated with his teammates, with eye protection(Supplied: Glenn Maxwell)
", "So why do they wear them?", "Put simply, it's to keep champagne out of their eyes.", "While it might seem like a nice problem to have, the alcohol content of champagne can cause damage to the eyes if too much of the good stuff gets in there.", "As an added bonus, the goggles also provide a little extra protection to any stray corks that might be flying around.", "The celebrations came as cricket legends throughout the world congratulated the Australians on their victory.", "Beaten New Zealand captain Kane Williamson led the congratulations for Australia after the match.", "\"They are a fantastic side,\" he said.", "Australia legend Shane Warne congratulated both teams on Twitter after the match, saying Australia \"peaked at the right time and had too many matchwinners for NZ [New Zealand].\"", "Two-time T20 World Cup-winning captain Daren Sammy wrote said he did think Australia would win the tournament.", "\"Congratulations to Australia,\" he wrote.", "\"I must admit I didn't see them being the champion team this tournament. But they've silently gone under the radar and came up with the goods every time. Well played Australia.\"", "Former England skipper Michael Vaughan said the Australians never looked back after their defeat to England.", "\"This is some World Cup win for the Aussies,\" he wrote.", "\"From the defeat to England, they have been so powerful.\"", "Adam Gilchrist, who won the 50-over World Cup three times, simply said it was pretty sweet to be a world champion.", "\"World Champions eh. Sweet,\" he wrote."]
